info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 1:12PM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
At 110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Fort Mc Coy to near Tomah to 7 miles east of Cashton. Movement was east at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated. wind reports received thus far have been 30 to 40 mph with these storms.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... New Lisbon and Elroy around 130 PM CDT. Mauston and Necedah around 135 PM CDT. Dellwood around 140 PM CDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include New Miner, Kens Marina And Campground, Mather, The Sprague Mather Flowage, The Necedah Wildlife Refuge, Lindina, Volk Field, Johnson Hill, Cutler, and Kelly.
This includes Interstate 90/94 between mile markers 53 and 78.
info.instruction:
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms.
If on or near the Wisconsin river, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle when storms approach. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT JUNEAU COUNTY THROUGH 200 PM CDT
